citeinfo.title: Dam Removals: U.S. Geological Survey GAGES-II time series data update

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of a table with a list of known dam removals for the conterminous United States sites of the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow II (GAGES-II) dataset. The dam removal locations and information were provided by American Rivers in December of 2014, then intersected with GAGES-II watersheds. Two records were added manually, as taken from Annual Data Report records published in GAGES-II.
descript.purpose: These data are intended as support for research efforts using the USGS GAGES-II sites.
descript.supplinf: This dataset is in support of study sites in the GAGES-II dataset (Falcone, 2011) and based on the watershed boundaries published there. References: American Rivers, 2014, Dams removed in the United States, 1930–2014, American Rivers digital data, accessed December 18, 2014, at https://www.americanrivers.org/threats-solutions/restoring-damaged-rivers/dam-removal-map/. Falcone, J.A., 2011, GAGES-II: Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow, U.S. Geological Survey digital spatial data set, http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/XML/gagesII_Sept2011.xml.

attracc.attraccr: Values were spot checked against source data.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.title: GAGES-II: Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow

srcinfo.srccontr: Sites for which these data provide updated data.

citeinfo.title: Dams removed in the United States, 1930–2014

srcinfo.srccontr: Dam removals locations and information provided by American Rivers

procstep.procdesc: (1) A list of dam removal locations and related information were provided by American Rivers (americanrivers.org) in December, 2014. The fields provided for these included latitude/longitude, year-removed, location (county or nearby city), river basin, state. Not all fields were populated. Those sites without latitude/longitude and without year-removed information were eliminated, leaving a set of 668 point locations. These were limited to the conterminous U.S.

(2) The dam removal points were intersected against GAGES-II watersheds. Only those GAGES-II sites with a dam removal are given in this dataset. The data here represent a one-to-many relationship with dam removals: a GAGES-II site may have one or more dam removals in this table.

(3) Two dam removals were added manually to this list, from comments in the GAGES-II Annual Data Reports (ADR), which are published as part of GAGES-II. These are a dam removal in 1982 in watershed 01399510, and one for 1969 in watershed 04122000. These two records are flagged with "ADR comment" in the Location field comment.

(4) The data presented here should be considered the best-available data for the time they were acquired, but do not necessarily represent a complete or nationally-consistent representation of all dams removed in this period. The data are somewhat skewed geographically, particularly towards the Upper Midwest and North East: there are many dam removals in a handful of states, namely Pennsylvania (209 of 668), Wisconsin (71 or 668), then no other state having more than 30 dam removals. Ten states have no dam removals in the data used for this processing (AZ, DE, KS, LA, MS, ND, NE, NV, OK, and WV).

enttyp.enttypl: Attribute Table for dam removal information
enttyp.enttypd: Data consist of a comma-separated text file

attr.attrdefs: Corresponds to unique station identifier in GAGES-II

attr.attrdef: The year the dam was removed.
Dam latitude in decimal degrees, datum NAD83
Dam longitude in decimal degrees, datum NAD83
Text information on general location of dam.
Text information on river basin location
Two letter state postal abbreviation at dam location
